primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The church/hearer, following the model of Jesus, must employ strategies of resistance and biblical memory to fend off voices of seduction and maintain their 'God-given humanness'.

subject.identificatie: The Hearer / The Church (modeled after Jesus)
tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is offered here as a guide and model and resource for how to resist
we must be ready with a thick, palpable response
The church is the place where we reflect on and decide to be differently human
to be who we are called by God to be
He was, perhaps, a Calvinist, because he has a high view of scripture
the whole, deep resource of faith memories
the folk who travel with him
He had the book of Deuteronomy with him
helper.rol_van_god: God is largely the Object of loyalty or a distant Sender, not the active Subject or Helper.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The preacher explicitly demythologizes the Devil into 'voices' and 'culture', making the conflict internal and social rather than cosmic.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The provision of 'angels' (sustenance) following successful resistance.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: God
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (God's action) is strictly conditional upon the success of the primary program (Human resistance).

voorbeelden_god_subject: angels came and ministered to him
this good God gives miraculously to the obedient
voorbeelden_mens_subject: you cannot make it up on the spot
we reflect on and decide to be differently human

voorbeelden: When we want to do best
He has his strategies at hand
capacity of the church... to resist
power to be freely and faithfully human

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon assumes the hearer has the 'Devoir' (duty) and needs the 'Savoir' (strategies/knowledge). It assumes 'Pouvoir' (power) is inherent in the human will if properly trained.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (threat) through ~S2 (strategies of memory) to reach S1 (humanness).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved through human effort and 'rehearsed' biblical knowledge.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; seen as a cultural pressure rather than a fatal condition.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon treats Jesus as a 'model' and 'guide' rather than a Savior. The engine of the narrative is human strategy and obedience.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is offered here as a guide and model and resource
just as soon as he resisted—but not before—food came

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God gave you food, just enough

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus' victory over temptation is presented as a repeatable strategy for the church.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Jesus resists where Israel and the Church fail, crediting his victory to the believer by grace.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform; reliance on intellectual memory.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Pelagian tendency; the human will is the primary mover.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: Highly coherent as a call to ethical action, but soteriologically hollow.
spanning_punten: The quote from Romans at the end contradicts the conditional nature of the rest of the sermon.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus is offered here as a guide and model

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon relies on 'ancient memories' rather than the Spirit's power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'thinning' and 'forgetting', not a state of death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon functions as a manual for self-improvement using biblical motifs.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'resisting' and 'deciding'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject who defeats the tempter on behalf of the helpless hearer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Jesus stood where we fall, and now His victory is our shield.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that the 'angels' minister to Jesus because he is the Son, and we are fed through Him.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how God enables the heart to love the Torah.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: If the opponent is just 'junk food', we don't need a Savior, just a nutritionist.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim the victory of Christ first, then the response of the church.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically brilliant but structurally anthropocentric. Shift the 'strategies' from human effort to God's faithfulness.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, it is engaging; actantially, it is a burden.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis is used to find 'models' rather than the 'Messiah'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'God' is a reward for performance rather than the initiator of the action.

appendices.notities: The sermon ends with a grace-filled quote from Romans that the preceding 1200 words did not earn.
